policy_name: Guidelines on the Use of Generative AI in Student Assessment and Coursework

scope.jurisdiction: University of Oxford and affiliated colleges

introduction: The University of Oxford recognizes the transformative potential of generative AI while maintaining commitment to academic integrity. These guidelines support responsible use of AI in learning and research.
key_principles: Authenticity: Your own thinking must be evident in assessed work
Transparency: Disclose all significant AI use
Criticality: Evaluate AI outputs with critical thinking
Accountability: You remain responsible for all submitted work
college_tutor_authority: Individual tutors may set stricter requirements than university guidelines. Always follow your college's specific guidance.

permitted_uses.description: Using AI to explore ideas, perspectives, and problem approaches
permitted_uses.scope: General learning activities unless restricted by tutor

permitted_uses.description: Using AI tutors to explain concepts in different ways
Using AI to generate drafts that you substantially revise
permitted_uses.scope: Essays, reports, and written work (check with tutor)

permitted_uses.description: Using AI for programming tasks with review and modification
Using AI for literature searching, organization, and analysis
permitted_uses.scope: Research and thesis work (check with supervisor)
permitted_uses.disclosure: Required in thesis or research paper

permitted_uses.description: Using AI for grammar, style, and clarity improvements

prohibited_practices.why_prohibited: Violates academic integrity by misrepresenting authorship
examples: Turning in AI-written sections without changes
prohibited_practices.penalty: Academic misconduct hearing, potential viva voce restrictions

prohibited_practices.why_prohibited: Violates specific assignment or examination rules
examples: Using AI when tutor explicitly prohibits
Using AI on marked coursework when forbidden
Using AI to generate fake citations
Creating invented data and attributing to research

prohibited_practices.why_prohibited: Prevents genuine understanding and skill development
examples: Using AI to avoid learning core skills
Relying on AI when assignment requires your analysis
Using AI to circumvent module learning objectives

how_to_disclose.example: The initial draft of this section was generated using ChatGPT (2025) and subsequently revised for accuracy and originality of analysis.
AI Disclosure: ChatGPT (OpenAI, January 2025) was used to generate literature search queries and organize citations. All content analysis is my own.
Data visualization was created using Python and AI-assisted code generation (GitHub Copilot) with human verification of all calculations.

what_to_disclose: Name and version of AI tool used
Specific purpose (e.g., brainstorming, code generation, writing support)
Extent of use (entire document vs. specific sections)
Modifications you made to AI output

detecting_concerning_patterns: Sudden change in writing style or complexity
Content that seems beyond demonstrated understanding
Lack of nuance or critical evaluation
Generic phrasing inconsistent with personal voice
responding_to_concerns: Interview student about their work and sources
Request viva voce examination on submitted work
Use AI detection tools as supporting evidence (not definitive)
Consider context and pattern of previous work
follow_up_questions: Can you explain your approach to this problem?
What did you initially think before doing this analysis?
What would you do differently if you did this again?
How did you come to this conclusion?

subject_specific_guidance.subject: Sciences
subject_specific_guidance.guidance: AI use in literature review and data visualization is encouraged with disclosure. Use of AI to interpret experimental results should be avoided unless explicitly supervised.

subject_specific_guidance.subject: Humanities
subject_specific_guidance.guidance: AI-generated content should be minimal. Critical analysis and interpretation must be entirely your own. Tutor approval recommended before extensive AI use.

subject_specific_guidance.subject: Engineering and Computer Science
subject_specific_guidance.guidance: AI code generation tools are permitted with disclosure and code review. You must understand and be able to explain all code submitted.

subject_specific_guidance.subject: Mathematics
subject_specific_guidance.guidance: AI tools are useful for checking calculations. Problem-solving approach must be your own. Prove that you understand all steps.

college_implementation.requirement: Each college must provide specific AI guidance in subject handbooks
college_implementation.timeline: Guidance must be provided within first week of term
college_implementation.accessibility: Guidance must be clear and available to all students

appeal_process: Students may appeal academic misconduct decisions through standard University procedures
